findings.title: Hardcoded Privileged Address Backdoor
findings.explanation: The withdraw function contains a hardcoded address check that allows that address to become Owner and drain the entire contract balance without proper authorization checks.
findings.fix_suggestion: Remove the hardcoded address logic. Implement a proper ownership transfer mechanism (e.g., OpenZeppelin Ownable) and restrict withdrawals only to the legitimate owner.

findings.title: Unchecked Low-Level Call in Command Function
findings.explanation: The contract uses adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking the return value, so if the external call fails, Ether may be lost or the call failure goes unnoticed.
findings.fix_suggestion: Capture and check the return value of the low-level call, e.g., `bool success = adr.call.value(msg.value)(data); require(success);` or use a safer interface instead of raw call.

unmatched_predictions.title: Unchecked Low-Level Call in Command Function
